content: In markdown format, create a table comparing the dominant music genres of the 18th, 19th, 20th, and 21st centuries, noting the major artists and characteristic features of each genre.

Certainly! Below is a table comparing the dominant music genres of the 18th, 19th, 20th, and 21st centuries, including major artists and characteristic features of each genre.

| Century | Dominant Genres | Major Artists | Characteristic Features |
|---------|-----------------|---------------|-------------------------|
| 18th    | Classical       | Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, Johann Sebastian Bach, Joseph Haydn | Emphasis on harmony, counterpoint, and form; use of orchestras and chamber ensembles; development of sonata form. |
|         | Baroque         | Antonio Vivaldi, George Frideric Handel | Complex musical forms, heavy use of basso continuo, ornate ornamentation, and a strong sense of drama. |
| 19th    | Romantic        | Ludwig van Beethoven, Frédéric Chopin, Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky | Emotionally expressive, expansion of musical forms, increased use of chromaticism and dissonance, and a focus on individualism. |
|         | Operatic        | Giuseppe Verdi, Richard Wagner | Grandiose productions, complex storylines, integration of music and drama, and the development of leitmotifs. |
| 20th    | Jazz            | Louis Armstrong, Duke Ellington, Miles Davis | Improvisation, syncopated rhythms, blue notes, and a blend of African and European musical elements. |
|         | Rock & Roll     | Elvis Presley, The Beatles, Led Zeppelin | Emphasis on rhythm, electric instruments, often associated with youth culture and rebellion. |
|         | Pop             | Michael Jackson, Madonna, Beyoncé | Catchy melodies, simple structures, often produced for mass appeal and radio play. |
| 21st    | Hip-Hop/Rap     | Tupac Shakur, Jay-Z, Kendrick Lamar | Rhythmic and rhyming speech over beats, often addressing social and political issues, and the use of sampling. |
|         | Electronic/Dance Music | Daft Punk, Calvin Harris, DJ Marshmello | Heavy use of synthesizers, drum machines, and digital audio workstations; often characterized by repetitive beats and melodies. |
|         | Indie/Alternative | Arcade Fire, Radiohead, Lorde | Diverse styles often outside the mainstream, emphasizing artistic expression and independence from major labels. |

**Note:** This table provides a general overview and is not exhaustive. Each century has seen a multitude of genres and artists, and the boundaries between genres are often blurred. This table focuses on some of the most prominent genres and artists of each period.
